title: Spain to Provide SatCen Access to National Earth Observation Data
summary:
Spain’s Ministry of Defence has signed an agreement with the European Union’s Satellite Centre (SatCen) to provide access to the country’s national Earth observation satellite system. SatCen was founded in 1992 and was incorporated as an EU agency in January 2002. The agency supports the EU’s decision-making in the field of Common Foreign and Security […]
The post Spain to Provide SatCen Access to National Earth Observation Data appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Musk Explains Starship Failure, Forecasts Humans on Mars in Eight Years

title: SpaceX testing ruggedized terminals for self-driving tractors
summary: John Deere has picked SpaceX to provide connectivity its farming machines need to operate autonomously in rural areas via a new, ruggedized user terminal.

title: NASA Names Vogel New Head of Space Technology
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson has chosen Kurt Vogel to be the new head of the Space Technology Mission Directorate. Vogel is relatively new to NASA, but had a long career […]

title: Pentagon awards $2.5 billion in satellite contracts to L3Harris, Lockheed Martin and Sierra Space
summary: The Pentagon on Tuesday announced about $2.5 billion in contracts will go to L3Harris, Lockheed Martin, and Sierra Space to build satellites for an expanding military system.
